parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.27

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Map

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Interaction

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Opens non-interactive main map in background that overrides user screen. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> When map is forced with this command, the user is able to fire but cannot see the world, just the map. The map cannot be closed manually and the user can get stuck requiring the game restart. Make sure you provide scripted mechanics to resolve this, should you need to force the map.</value></part></template><br>
To force open interactive map use [[openMap]] command.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''forceMap''' show

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> show: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[forceMap]] [[true]]</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[forcedMap]], [[showMap]], [[shownMap]], [[openMap]], [[visibleMap]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP v1.96''', the mapAnim series of commands, together with [[forceMap]] can only be used in the intro and mission, as it is not possible to access the map from the outro. ''(not checked, sourced from an old copy of the OFPEC comref)''

<dt class="note">[[User:Manny|Manny]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Manually opening the map afterwards won't close the map. Actually it will open the "real" map on top of the forced map, and closing the (top) map with the ''m''-key again will still show the forcefully opened map. (ArmA 1.05)

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
